intro: Eloyella panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian eloyella, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. Eloyella panamensis is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
